misuses.description: The IV (Initialization Vector) is hardcoded, which can be exploited by an attacker to predict the next block of plaintext.
misuses.recommendation: Use a secure and random IV, such as /dev/urandom on Linux or SecureRandom.getBytes in Java.

misuses.description: The AES key length is too short (128 bits), which can be brute-forced by a determined attacker.
misuses.recommendation: Use a longer AES key, such as AES-256.
